publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2732# Irene Oldfather: Europe Day - 9 May 2005—That the Parliament is proud to mark Europe Day as a celebration of the founding of the European Union (EU); endorses the fundamental principles of the EU as set out in the declaration by Robert Schumann on 9 May 1950; welcomes the contribution that the EU has made towards peace and solidarity across Europe; notes that this year it falls one day after the 60th anniversary of VE Day on 8 May 1945; acknowledges that the principles on which the EU was founded are now more important than ever, and considers that the people of Scotland should join the citizens of Europe in the celebration of our common values on Europe Day. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-2732 # Irene Oldfather:Europe Day - 9 May 2005—That the Parliament is proud to mark Europe Day as a celebration of the founding of the European Union (EU); endorses the fundamental principles of the EU as set out in the declaration by Robert Schumann on 9 May 1950; welcomes the contribution that the EU has made towards peace and solidarity across Europe; notes that this year it falls one day after the 60th anniversary of VE Day on 8 May 1945; acknowledges that the principles on which the EU was founded are now more important than ever, and considers that the people of Scotland should join the citizens of Europe in the celebration of our common values on Europe Day. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S2M-2732# Europe Day - 9 May 2005 (lodged on 26 April 2005) Dr Elaine Murray*, Margaret Jamieson*, Jackie Baillie*, Michael McMahon*, Cathie Craigie*, Mike Pringle*, Sarah Boyack*, Christine May*, Linda Fabiani*
